text.div:
Root Cause

CodeDescriptionCommentVersion
AP Analysis ProcessEnter (AP) when ANALYSIS PROCESS is the reason due to: • Product or supply failure (reagents, calibrators, QC material) • Equipment or instrumentation failureadded v2.8
IM Information ManagementEnter (IM) when INFORMATION MANAGEMENT is the reason due to:<p>â¢ Database or Programming issues<p>â¢ Overriding of test results<p>â¢ Inaccurate calculations<p>â¢ Inaccurate flagging, reference ranges, units of measure<p>â¢ Incomplete/inaccurate tranadded v2.8
L LaboratoryEnter (L) when LABORATORY is the reason due to:<p>â¢ Data Entry error<p>â¢ Testing/Technical error<p>â¢ Repeat testing causing change to test resultadded v2.8
NA Not ApplicableEnter (NA) when NOT-APPLICABLE is the reason due to:<p>â¢ If no revisions performed or<p>â¢ unable to determine reason for revision<p>Note: Do not use NA if result code status is not corrected (revised) or if a preliminary release of results with a coradded v2.8
PD Placer DataEnter (PD) when new or changed PLACER DATA information is the reason due to:<p>â¢ Changed patient demographics or<p>â¢ Result code data provided by the client on the requisition or specimen manifest that will be entered during order entry (i.e. Previousadded v2.8

description: FHIR Value set/code system definition for HL7 v2 table 0914 ( Root Cause)
